snippet: The numbers are being quietly fought over in e-mails among malaria specialists at the World Health Organization and the University of Washington.
abstract: Malaria specialists are at odds over the number of people killed by malaria in 2011; study published in journal The Lancet claims the official World Health Organization estimate of 655,000 is far too low and that actual number of deaths may be 1.2 million.
lead_paragraph: The numbers are being quietly fought over in e-mails among malaria specialists at the World Health Organization and the University of Washington.

headline.seo: Did Malaria Kill 655,000 People in 2011 or Twice That?
headline.main: Malaria: Specialists Duel Over Death Toll in 2011: Was It 655,000 People or Twice as Many?
headline.print_headline: Malaria: Specialists Duel Over Death Toll in 2011: Was It 655,000 People or Twice as Many?
